card.title: ERIC ‚Äì The Electronic Registration Information Center - A dream database for voter fraud - American Policy Center

_source.content: The Electronic Registration Information Center (ERIC) is a nation-wide voter data-gathering system, funded by the Pew Center and an ‚Äúanonymous‚Äù donor, the Soros Open Society.  Designed by activists in 2014, it is a membership organization established to maintain states‚Äô voter rolls.  Please don‚Äôt misunderstand.  Legitimate maintenance of voter rolls, although required of every state by law, was not the intent of ERIC.Eleven blue states joined the first year, 2014.  Membership was up to 22 states by 2017, which was the last year that it published an annual report.  By 2022, 31 states ‚Äì some red and some blue! ‚Äì were a part of the Center.ERIC‚Äôs advertised purpose at its outset was to provide states a system of voter roll management.   Provision of this data to the public is something  that the Democrat Party has fought against for decades, since the NVRA (‚Äúmotor voter‚Äù act)  became federal law in 1993.  That Act allows public inspection of ‚Äúvoter list maintenance records‚Äù  ‚Äì which has, of course, become hugely contentious since the blatant election fraud took place in 2020.  ERIC is a voluntary membership organization which charges each member $25,000 annual membership fee ‚Äì for its services.Each member state is mandated by the ERIC bylaws, to submit ALL details on every voter, both active and inactive, to ERIC every 60 days.  Along with this, states must give over all data from their motor vehicle registration divisions.  This provides ERIC the information on everyone with a drivers license or even a learner‚Äôs permit PLUS all ID recipients which include illegals, elderly shut-ins, etc.  For this, ERIC then gives each member state a targeted list of all those NOT registered to vote, and requires that the state contact a  minimum of 95% of these people within 90 days,  soliciting them to register.  https://americanpolicy.org/2022/02/25/eric-the-electronic-registration-information-center-a-dream-database-for-voter-fraud/
_source.contentraw:
The Electronic Registration Information Center (ERIC) is a nation-wide voter data-gathering system, funded by the Pew Center and an ‚Äúanonymous‚Äù donor, the Soros Open Society. Designed by activists in 2014, it is a membership organization established to maintain states‚Äô voter rolls. Please don‚Äôt misunderstand. Legitimate maintenance of voter rolls, although required of every state by law, was not the intent of ERIC.
Eleven blue states joined the first year, 2014. Membership was up to 22 states by 2017, which was the last year that it published an annual report. By 2022, 31 states ‚Äì some red and some blue! ‚Äì were a part of the Center.
ERIC‚Äôs advertised purpose at its outset was to provide states a system of voter roll management. Provision of this data to the public is something that the Democrat Party has fought against for decades, since the NVRA (‚Äúmotor voter‚Äù act) became federal law in 1993. That Act allows public inspection of ‚Äúvoter list maintenance records‚Äù ‚Äì which has, of course, become hugely contentious since the blatant election fraud took place in 2020.
ERIC is a voluntary membership organization which charges each member $25,000 annual membership fee ‚Äì for its services.
Each member state is mandated by the ERIC bylaws, to submit ALL details on every voter, both active and inactive, to ERIC every 60 days. Along with this, states must give over all data from their motor vehicle registration divisions. This provides ERIC the information on everyone with a drivers license or even a learner‚Äôs permit PLUS all ID recipients which include illegals, elderly shut-ins, etc. For this, ERIC then gives each member state a targeted list of all those NOT registered to vote, and requires that the state contact a minimum of 95% of these people within 90 days, soliciting them to register.
https://americanpolicy.org/2022/02/25/eric-the-electronic-registration-information-center-a-dream-database-for-voter-fraud/

_source.content: Biden White House Colluded With Big Tech To Censor COVID Info, Emails Prove.Officials from the Biden White House and other federal agencies have repeatedly colluded with social media companies, including Twitter and Facebook, on censoring COVID-19 stories.The relationship between the federal government and major social media platforms was unearthed through a lawsuit filed by Missouri Attorney General Eric Schmitt and Louisiana Attorney General Jeff Landry in May.Though more documents and emails are expected to be revealed as a result of the lawsuit, currently available communications obtained by the offices of the Attorneys General already show a deep relationship between 45 officials from the Department of Homeland Security, Center for Disease Control, National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Disease, Office of the Surgeon General, and Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency.Officials from the aforementioned agencies have communicated with social media platforms on issues such as COVID-19 ‚Äúmisinformation‚Äù and, in response, censorship.Ôªøhttps://thenationalpulse.com/2022/09/01/emails-show-federal-government-colluded-on-covid-censorship/
_source.contentraw:
Biden White House Colluded With Big Tech To Censor COVID Info, Emails Prove.

Officials from the Biden White House and other federal agencies have repeatedly colluded with social media companies, including Twitter and Facebook, on censoring COVID-19 stories.

The relationship between the federal government and major social media platforms was unearthed through a lawsuit filed by Missouri Attorney General Eric Schmitt and Louisiana Attorney General Jeff Landry in May.

Though more documents and emails are expected to be revealed as a result of the lawsuit, currently available communications obtained by the offices of the Attorneys General already show a deep relationship between 45 officials from the Department of Homeland Security, Center for Disease Control, National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Disease, Office of the Surgeon General, and Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency.

Officials from the aforementioned agencies have communicated with social media platforms on issues such as COVID-19 ‚Äúmisinformation‚Äù and, in response, censorship.

_source.content: More than 50 Biden officials in 12 federal government agencies have been exposed for colluding with Big Tech to censor their political opponents in a major lawsuit filed by state attorneys general.The state attorneys general in Missouri and Louisiana amended a blockbuster lawsuit filed in May that reveals the extent the Biden White House, Department of State, FBI, and major social media companies colluded to infringe on citizens‚Äô free speech rights. The right to fully participate in political debate is a fundamental pillar of America‚Äôs constitutional system of government.The lawsuit documents show the government‚Äôs intent to infringe on Americans‚Äô First Amendment Rights and curb their ability to discuss matters of health policy and U.S. elections through social media channels.In the lawsuit, the state AGs are compelling the Justice Dept. to turn over communications the Biden administration had with Big Tech companies that pertain to matters such as health policy and election interference.‚ÄúYesterday, Missouri Attorney General Eric Schmitt and Louisiana Attorney General Jeff Landry filed a Joint Statement on Discovery Disputes, asking the Louisiana District Court to compel the Department of Justice to turn over communications between high-ranking Biden Administration officials from the White House, Department of State, FBI and others and major social media companies,‚Äù a joint statement on Thursday noted. ‚ÄúThe Department of Justice has already turned over communications between a number of federal officials and social media companies but has refused to provide communications between top-ranking officials and social media companies.‚ÄùThe lawsuit would focus on the widespread and coordinated ‚Äúcensorship enterprise‚Äù to rig U.S. elections. It comes in the aftermath of revelations that Facebook/Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg was approached by the FBI to suppress the Hunter Biden story.https://beckernews.com/new-50-biden-officials-46718/
_source.contentraw:
More than 50 Biden officials in 12 federal government agencies have been exposed for colluding with Big Tech to censor their political opponents in a major lawsuit filed by state attorneys general.

The state attorneys general in Missouri and Louisiana amended a blockbuster lawsuit filed in May that reveals the extent the Biden White House, Department of State, FBI, and major social media companies colluded to infringe on citizens‚Äô free speech rights. The right to fully participate in political debate is a fundamental pillar of America‚Äôs constitutional system of government.

The lawsuit documents show the government‚Äôs intent to infringe on Americans‚Äô First Amendment Rights and curb their ability to discuss matters of health policy and U.S. elections through social media channels.

In the lawsuit, the state AGs are compelling the Justice Dept. to turn over communications the Biden administration had with Big Tech companies that pertain to matters such as health policy and election interference.

‚ÄúYesterday, Missouri Attorney General Eric Schmitt and Louisiana Attorney General Jeff Landry filed a Joint Statement on Discovery Disputes, asking the Louisiana District Court to compel the Department of Justice to turn over communications between high-ranking Biden Administration officials from the White House, Department of State, FBI and others and major social media companies,‚Äù a joint statement on Thursday noted. ‚ÄúThe Department of Justice has already turned over communications between a number of federal officials and social media companies but has refused to provide communications between top-ranking officials and social media companies.‚Äù

The lawsuit would focus on the widespread and coordinated ‚Äúcensorship enterprise‚Äù to rig U.S. elections. It comes in the aftermath of revelations that Facebook/Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg was approached by the FBI to suppress the Hunter Biden story.

https://beckernews.com/new-50-biden-officials-46718/

card.title: Hunter Biden set up dinner for client at Chinese Embassy in DC after Joe‚Äôs luncheon: emails

_source.content: Hunter Biden set up dinner for client at Chinese Embassy in DC after Joe‚Äôs luncheon: emailsNY Post ^ | September 1, 2022 | By Mark Moore and Miranda Devinehttps://nypost.com/2022/09/01/hunter-biden-set-up-dinner-for-client-at-chinese-embassy-in-dc-after-joes-luncheon-emails/First son Hunter Biden helped to arrange a dinner at the Chinese Embassy in Washington for a client of his now-defunct investment company ‚Äî by working with a top Beijing diplomatic official he met at a January 2011 luncheon hosted by his father, then-Vice President Joe Biden, according to correspondence obtained by The Post and Fox News Digital.Hunter and Eric Schwerin, his former business associate at Rosemont Seneca Partners, assisted Marvin Lang ‚Äî the managing director of Guardian Realty in Maryland ‚Äî in setting up the dinner with Deng Hongbo, the embassy‚Äôs deputy chief of mission, on April 28, 2011.The dinner was later publicized on China‚Äôs Ministry of Foreign Affairs website.The idea for the dinner arose in emails exchanged by Schwerin, Lang and Hunter Biden in December 2010.Lang, a major Democratic donor, contacted the then-vice president‚Äôs son to thank him for a lunch meeting and to say he was ‚Äúexcited‚Äù to establish a ‚Äúlong relationship‚Äù with Rosemont.On Jan. 12, 2011, following an exchange of messages among the three, Hunter Biden emailed Schwerin to say: ‚ÄúMarvin wants to know where we are in on finding space for the dinner ‚Äî Chinese embassy is his #1 choice.‚ÄùSeven days later, Schwerin contacted Lang and cc‚Äôd Hunter Biden in an email to notify him that Hunter Biden had had a lunch with the ‚Äúnumber three official‚Äù at the Chinese Embassy and the contact would be ‚Äúhelpful‚Äù in setting up the dinner for Guardian Realty, which describes itself as a ‚Äúfully integrated real estate investment company‚Äù on its website.
_source.contentraw:
Hunter Biden set up dinner for client at Chinese Embassy in DC after Joe‚Äôs luncheon: emails
NY Post ^ | September 1, 2022 | By Mark Moore and Miranda Devine
https://nypost.com/2022/09/01/hunter-biden-set-up-dinner-for-client-at-chinese-embassy-in-dc-after-joes-luncheon-emails/

First son Hunter Biden helped to arrange a dinner at the Chinese Embassy in Washington for a client of his now-defunct investment company ‚Äî by working with a top Beijing diplomatic official he met at a January 2011 luncheon hosted by his father, then-Vice President Joe Biden, according to correspondence obtained by The Post and Fox News Digital.

Hunter and Eric Schwerin, his former business associate at Rosemont Seneca Partners, assisted Marvin Lang ‚Äî the managing director of Guardian Realty in Maryland ‚Äî in setting up the dinner with Deng Hongbo, the embassy‚Äôs deputy chief of mission, on April 28, 2011.

The dinner was later publicized on China‚Äôs Ministry of Foreign Affairs website.

The idea for the dinner arose in emails exchanged by Schwerin, Lang and Hunter Biden in December 2010.

Lang, a major Democratic donor, contacted the then-vice president‚Äôs son to thank him for a lunch meeting and to say he was ‚Äúexcited‚Äù to establish a ‚Äúlong relationship‚Äù with Rosemont.

On Jan. 12, 2011, following an exchange of messages among the three, Hunter Biden emailed Schwerin to say: ‚ÄúMarvin wants to know where we are in on finding space for the dinner ‚Äî Chinese embassy is his #1 choice.‚Äù

Seven days later, Schwerin contacted Lang and cc‚Äôd Hunter Biden in an email to notify him that Hunter Biden had had a lunch with the ‚Äúnumber three official‚Äù at the Chinese Embassy and the contact would be ‚Äúhelpful‚Äù in setting up the dinner for Guardian Realty, which describes itself as a ‚Äúfully integrated real estate investment company‚Äù on its website.

_source.contentraw:
From "Wake Up Right" ~

"HOW BIDEN AND SOCIAL MEDIA CENSORED AMERICANS

New evidence shows how deep the collusion went between the Biden regime and Big Tech in order to censor critics on social media - even coordinating to ban a parody account that mocked Dr. Fauci.

The details: Two Republican state Attorney Generals [Louisiana AG Jeff Landry and Missouri AG Eric Schmitt] are suing the Biden regime, demanding the release of e-mails between government officials and Big Tech. In their filing, the AGs released e-mails and documents already in their possession that highlight their concerns about collusion.

The AG's suit alleges that ‚Äúdozens of federal officials across at least eleven federal agencies‚Äù engaged in a ‚Äúmassive, sprawling federal ‚ÄòCensorship Enterprise,'‚Äù with the ‚Äúintent and effect of pressuring social-media platforms to censor and suppress private speech that federal officials disfavor.‚Äù

Dr. Fauci parody account: In one example of collusion, the Biden regime's Digital Director e-mailed Instagram and said:

‚ÄúHi there ‚Äì any way we can get this pulled down? It is not actually one of ours"
Less than one minute later, Instagram replied: ‚ÄúYep, on it!‚Äù

"Debunking meetings": In another e-mail chain released by the AGs, the Biden regime and Facebook discuss setting up weekly meetings in addition to "doing a monthly misinfo / debunking meeting."

Back up: This should come as no surprise...

In 2021, White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki said the regime was ‚Äúflagging problematic posts for Facebook that spread disinformation.‚Äù

In July of 2021, Facebook informed the Biden regime that it had, ‚Äúremoved 17 additional Pages, Groups and Instagram accounts tied to the disinfo dozen." The Disinfo dozen refers to a group of outspoken critics of the handling of the covid pandemic treatments.

Just last week Mark Zuckerberg admitted on the Joe Rogan podcast that the FBI told them to censor the Hunter Biden laptop story ahead of the 2020 election.

Big picture: New Civil Liberties Alliance lawyer Jenin Younes said: "If there was ever any doubt the federal government was behind censorship of Americans who dared to dissent from official Covid messaging, that doubt has been erased."

[Source: Just the News, NY Post]"

_source.content: Smoking Gun Emails Show Deep Coordination Between Social Media and Biden Admin in Vast 'Censorship Enterprise'Red State ^ | 09/01/2022 | Nick Aramahttps://redstate.com/nick-arama/2022/09/01/smoking-gun-emails-show-deep-coordination-between-social-media-and-biden-admin-in-vast-censorship-enterprise-n621211There‚Äôs an important update on the lawsuit that Missouri and Louisiana filed back in May against members of the Biden Administration, including Joe Biden, to expose the collusion between them and social media companies to censor speech on a variety of subjects‚Äìincluding things like the Hunter Biden laptop and COVID.‚ÄúBig Tech has become an extension of Biden‚Äôs Big Government, and neither are protecting the freedoms of Americans; rather, they are suppressing truth and demonizing those who think differently,‚Äù said Attorney General Landry. ‚ÄúRipped from the playbook of Stalin and his ilk, Biden has been colluding with Big Tech to censor free speech and propagandize the masses. We are fighting back to ensure the rule of law and prevent the government from unconstitutional banning, chilling, and stifling of speech.‚ÄùNow, Missouri and Louisiana are detailing in a joint statement some of what they have uncovered in the suit so far, and it spells big trouble for the Biden Administration, according to Missouri Attorney General Eric Schmitt.‚ÄúWe have already received a number of documents that clearly prove that the federal government has an incestuous relationship with social media companies and clearly coordinate to censor freedom of speech, but we‚Äôre not done,‚Äù Schmitt said.‚ÄùThe Department of Justice is cowering behind executive privilege and has refused to turn over communications between the highest-ranking Biden Administration officials and social media companies. That‚Äôs why, yesterday, we asked the Court to compel the Department of Justice to produce those records. We‚Äôre just getting started ‚Äì stay tuned.‚ÄùThe joint statement called it a vast ‚ÄúCensorship Enterprise.‚Äù It explained that the DOJ provided the two states with information pursuant to the suit, identifying 45 federal officials who have interacted with social media companies on misinformation. But on top of that, Meta identified 32 additional federal officials, including White House officials, who communicated with them; YouTube also identified 11 federal officials, including White House officials, many of whom were not disclosed by the DOJ.The joint statement continues, ‚ÄúThe discovery provided so far demonstrates that this Censorship Enterprise is extremely broad, including officials in the White House, HHS, DHS, CISA, the CDC, NIAID, and the Office of the Surgeon General; and evidently other agencies as well, such as the Census Bureau, the FDA, the FBI, the State Department, the Treasury Department, and the U.S. Election Assistance Commission. And it rises to the highest levels of the U.S. Government, including numerous White House officials. Defendants have objected to producing some of the most relevant and probative information in their possession.‚ÄùA senior FB official sent an email to the Surgeon General stating, ‚ÄúI know our teams met today to better understand the scope of what the White House expects from us on misinformation going forward.‚Äù This email chain follows the SG‚Äôs ‚Äúmisinformation health advisory‚Äù in July 2021.
_source.contentraw:
Smoking Gun Emails Show Deep Coordination Between Social Media and Biden Admin in Vast 'Censorship Enterprise'
Red State ^ | 09/01/2022 | Nick Arama
https://redstate.com/nick-arama/2022/09/01/smoking-gun-emails-show-deep-coordination-between-social-media-and-biden-admin-in-vast-censorship-enterprise-n621211

There‚Äôs an important update on the lawsuit that Missouri and Louisiana filed back in May against members of the Biden Administration, including Joe Biden, to expose the collusion between them and social media companies to censor speech on a variety of subjects‚Äìincluding things like the Hunter Biden laptop and COVID.

‚ÄúBig Tech has become an extension of Biden‚Äôs Big Government, and neither are protecting the freedoms of Americans; rather, they are suppressing truth and demonizing those who think differently,‚Äù said Attorney General Landry. ‚ÄúRipped from the playbook of Stalin and his ilk, Biden has been colluding with Big Tech to censor free speech and propagandize the masses. We are fighting back to ensure the rule of law and prevent the government from unconstitutional banning, chilling, and stifling of speech.‚Äù

Now, Missouri and Louisiana are detailing in a joint statement some of what they have uncovered in the suit so far, and it spells big trouble for the Biden Administration, according to Missouri Attorney General Eric Schmitt.

‚ÄúWe have already received a number of documents that clearly prove that the federal government has an incestuous relationship with social media companies and clearly coordinate to censor freedom of speech, but we‚Äôre not done,‚Äù Schmitt said.‚ÄùThe Department of Justice is cowering behind executive privilege and has refused to turn over communications between the highest-ranking Biden Administration officials and social media companies. That‚Äôs why, yesterday, we asked the Court to compel the Department of Justice to produce those records. We‚Äôre just getting started ‚Äì stay tuned.‚Äù

The joint statement called it a vast ‚ÄúCensorship Enterprise.‚Äù It explained that the DOJ provided the two states with information pursuant to the suit, identifying 45 federal officials who have interacted with social media companies on misinformation. But on top of that, Meta identified 32 additional federal officials, including White House officials, who communicated with them; YouTube also identified 11 federal officials, including White House officials, many of whom were not disclosed by the DOJ.

The joint statement continues, ‚ÄúThe discovery provided so far demonstrates that this Censorship Enterprise is extremely broad, including officials in the White House, HHS, DHS, CISA, the CDC, NIAID, and the Office of the Surgeon General; and evidently other agencies as well, such as the Census Bureau, the FDA, the FBI, the State Department, the Treasury Department, and the U.S. Election Assistance Commission. And it rises to the highest levels of the U.S. Government, including numerous White House officials. Defendants have objected to producing some of the most relevant and probative information in their possession.‚Äù

A senior FB official sent an email to the Surgeon General stating, ‚ÄúI know our teams met today to better understand the scope of what the White House expects from us on misinformation going forward.‚Äù This email chain follows the SG‚Äôs ‚Äúmisinformation health advisory‚Äù in July 2021.

_source.content: State attorneys general in Missouri and Louisiana have filed a blockbuster lawsuit that would reveal the extent of election interference, if successful, that was committed by ‚Äúthe Biden White House, Department of State, FBI, and major social media companies.‚ÄùIn the lawsuit, the state AGs are now compelling the Justice Dept. to turn over communications the Biden administration had with Big Tech companies that pertain to alleged election collusion. According to the press release issued Thursday on the new lawsuit:‚ÄúYesterday, Missouri Attorney General Eric Schmitt and Louisiana Attorney General Jeff Landry filed a Joint Statement on Discovery Disputes, asking the Louisiana District Court to compel the Department of Justice to turn over communications between high-ranking Biden Administration officials from the White House, Department of State, FBI and others and major social media companies. The Department of Justice has already turned over communications between a number of federal officials and social media companies but has refused to provide communications between top-ranking officials and social media companies.‚Äù The state AGs provided a number of examples of the accused election interference and collusion with Big Tech companies:A senior Facebook official sent an email to the Surgeon General stating, ‚ÄúI know our teams met today to better understand the scope of what the White House expects from us on misinformation going forward.‚Äù This email chain follows the SG‚Äôs ‚Äúmisinformation health advisory‚Äù in July 2021: https://ago.mo.gov/docs/default-source/press-releases/free-speech-pitch-thread-docs/hhs-fb-email-1.pdf?sfvrsn=53bc4454_2The same senior official sent a later email to HHS and noted, ‚ÄúThanks again for taking the time to meet earlier today.‚Äù Then, the official continued to discuss how Facebook is taking even more steps to censor freedom of speech: https://ago.mo.gov/docs/default-source/press-releases/free-speech-pitch-thread-docs/hhs-fb-exhibit.pdf?sfvrsn=55bd83df_2Twitter scheduled a meeting to debrief top White House officials on ‚Äúvaccine misinformation.‚Äù: https://ago.mo.gov/docs/default-source/press-releases/free-speech-pitch-thread-docs/twitter-vaccine-meeting-wh.pdf?sfvrsn=6599e359_2bThere are several instances where Facebook wouldn‚Äôt proceed with censoring freedom of speech on their platform until they had input, or a ‚Äúdebunking‚Äù from the CDC. Twitter followed the same course in at least one email.Example 1: https://ago.mo.gov/docs/default-source/press-releases/free-speech-pitch-thread-docs/fb-cdc-child-vaccine.pdf?sfvrsn=2f8960de_2Example 2: https://ago.mo.gov/docs/default-source/press-releases/free-speech-pitch-thread-docs/fb-cdc-omicron.pdf?sfvrsn=78eb53ec_2Twitter example: https://ago.mo.gov/docs/default-source/press-releases/free-speech-pitch-thread-docs/twitter‚Äìcdc-action.pdf?sfvrsn=12c0dc46_2The CDC also proposed a monthly pre-debunking meeting with Facebook to help them censor free speech (https://ago.mo.gov/docs/default-source/press-releases/free-speech-pitch-thread-docs/cdc-fb-monthly-debunk.pdf?sfvrsn=3508a21f_2) as well as regular ‚ÄúBe on the Lookout‚Äù calls with major social media outlets: https://ago.mo.gov/docs/default-source/press-releases/free-speech-pitch-thread-docs/cdc-bolo-meeting.pdf?sfvrsn=9a060658_2A White House official was even concerned about parody Fauci accounts and coordinated with FB to take them down: https://ago.mo.gov/docs/default-source/press-releases/free-speech-pitch-thread-docs/fake-fauci.pdf?sfvrsn=a9d8f2bf_2Source:  http://beckernews.com

State attorneys general in Missouri and Louisiana have filed a blockbuster lawsuit that would reveal the extent of election interference, if successful, that was committed by ‚Äúthe Biden White House, Department of State, FBI, and major social media companies.‚Äù
In the lawsuit, the state AGs are now compelling the Justice Dept. to turn over communications the Biden administration had with Big Tech companies that pertain to alleged election collusion. According to the press release issued Thursday on the new lawsuit:
‚ÄúYesterday, Missouri Attorney General Eric Schmitt and Louisiana Attorney General Jeff Landry filed a Joint Statement on Discovery Disputes, asking the Louisiana District Court to compel the Department of Justice to turn over communications between high-ranking Biden Administration officials from the White House, Department of State, FBI and others and major social media companies. The Department of Justice has already turned over communications between a number of federal officials and social media companies but has refused to provide communications between top-ranking officials and social media companies.‚Äù



The state AGs provided a number of examples of the accused election interference and collusion with Big Tech companies:
A senior Facebook official sent an email to the Surgeon General stating, ‚ÄúI know our teams met today to better understand the scope of what the White House expects from us on misinformation going forward.‚Äù This email chain follows the SG‚Äôs ‚Äúmisinformation health advisory‚Äù in July 2021: https://ago.mo.gov/docs/default-source/press-releases/free-speech-pitch-thread-docs/hhs-fb-email-1.pdf?sfvrsn=53bc4454_2The same senior official sent a later email to HHS and noted, ‚ÄúThanks again for taking the time to meet earlier today.‚Äù Then, the official continued to discuss how Facebook is taking even more steps to censor freedom of speech: https://ago.mo.gov/docs/default-source/press-releases/free-speech-pitch-thread-docs/hhs-fb-exhibit.pdf?sfvrsn=55bd83df_2Twitter scheduled a meeting to debrief top White House officials on ‚Äúvaccine misinformation.‚Äù: https://ago.mo.gov/docs/default-source/press-releases/free-speech-pitch-thread-docs/twitter-vaccine-meeting-wh.pdf?sfvrsn=6599e359_2bThere are several instances where Facebook wouldn‚Äôt proceed with censoring freedom of speech on their platform until they had input, or a ‚Äúdebunking‚Äù from the CDC. Twitter followed the same course in at least one email.

The CDC also proposed a monthly pre-debunking meeting with Facebook to help them censor free speech (https://ago.mo.gov/docs/default-source/press-releases/free-speech-pitch-thread-docs/cdc-fb-monthly-debunk.pdf?sfvrsn=3508a21f_2) as well as regular ‚ÄúBe on the Lookout‚Äù calls with major social media outlets: https://ago.mo.gov/docs/default-source/press-releases/free-speech-pitch-thread-docs/cdc-bolo-meeting.pdf?sfvrsn=9a060658_2
